question: [File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Field Mutations] [Atomicity] Can partial config updates occur where enabled=true is applied but processor_task_count/batch_size changes haven't propagated, causing inconsistent service behavior? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Clone Trait] [Deep Copy Race] Does the Clone implementation at line 22 create a shallow copy vulnerability where mutable references to nested config objects can be modified during clone operations? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Field: enabled] [State Machine] Can indexer_grpc.enabled be toggled from true to false at runtime without properly shutting down active gRPC connections, causing connection leaks or partial transaction streams? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Field: use_data_service_interface] [Interface Switch] Can use_data_service_interface be changed at runtime causing interface incompatibility where clients expecting standard fullnode API receive data service responses, breaking client parsers? (High)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Dependency Chain] Does the sanitizer verify that when indexer_grpc.enabled=true, all dependent services (storage layer, state sync, transaction processors) are properly configured and available? (High)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Cross-Config Dependencies] [Validation Gap] Can storage.enable_indexer be disabled after sanitization passes, breaking the dependency requirement without triggering re-validation? (High)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_TASK_COUNT] [Resource Limits] Is DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_TASK_COUNT=20 too high for resource-constrained nodes, potentially causing thread exhaustion on low-memory validators? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_BATCH_SIZE] [Memory Consumption] Is DEFAULT_PROCESSOR_BATCH_SIZE=1000 too large for memory safety, potentially causing OOM when 20 tasks × 1000 transactions = 20k transactions held in memory? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_OUTPUT_BATCH_SIZE] [Network Buffer] Is DEFAULT_OUTPUT_BATCH_SIZE=100 optimal for preventing gRPC stream fragmentation while avoiding memory exhaustion in network buffers? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_GRPC_STREAM_PORT] [Well-Known Port] Is DEFAULT_GRPC_STREAM_PORT=50051 a well-known gRPC port that makes Aptos indexers easy targets for network scanning and DDoS attacks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Default Implementation] [enabled=false] Does the default of enabled=false provide defense-in-depth, or can forgotten config overwrites accidentally enable indexer services in production validators? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Default Implementation] [use_data_service_interface=false] Can the default use_data_service_interface=false cause API incompatibility issues where clients expect one interface but receive another? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Error Message] Does the error message at lines 99-102 leak sensitive configuration details that could aid attackers in understanding internal indexer architecture? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Error Recovery] When sanitization fails, does the system continue with default values, revert to last-known-good config, or crash, potentially causing service unavailability? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Result Type] [Error Propagation] Can errors from sanitize() or optimize() be silently ignored by calling code, allowing invalid configurations to propagate into production? (High)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Panic Paths] Can the sanitizer panic on unexpected node_config field states (null/missing fields) instead of returning proper error results? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Test: test_sanitize_enable_indexer] [Coverage Gap] Does the test at lines 131-183 only validate the happy path and one error case, missing edge cases like u16::MAX values, zero values, or concurrent config changes? (Medium)
[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Test Coverage] [Missing Tests] Are there no tests for optimize() function behavior, potentially hiding bugs in config optimization logic? (Low)
[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Test Coverage] [Missing Tests] Are there no tests validating Default implementation produces secure-by-default values? (Low)
[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Test Coverage] [Missing Tests] Are there no tests for concurrent config access, deserialization edge cases, or invalid SocketAddr formats? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [PartialEq Trait] [Comparison Logic] Does PartialEq comparison at line 22 properly handle floating point precision issues in SocketAddr comparison, or can it produce false equivalence? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Debug Trait] [Information Disclosure] Does the Debug implementation at lines 46-60 print sensitive configuration details (IP addresses, port numbers) to logs that could aid network reconnaissance? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [u16 Type] [Integer Promotion] When u16 values are multiplied (processor_task_count × processor_batch_size), can integer promotion to u32/u64 cause unexpected overflow behavior? (Medium)
[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [SocketAddr Type] [IPv4 vs IPv6] Is the SocketAddr type properly validated to ensure IPv4/IPv6 compatibility with the underlying network stack? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/indexer_grpc_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Storage Dependency] Can storage.enable_indexer be in an inconsistent state during node startup, causing the sanitizer to pass but runtime indexer initialization to fail? (High)
